definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)

sentences.english: Hilary:Do you take naps at noon or feel sleepy?
sentences.chinese: 你白天有睡午覺或是打瞌睡嗎？

sentences.english: Grandpa is really cranky if he doesn’t have his afternoon nap.
sentences.chinese: 祖父如果不睡午覺就會很暴躁。

sentences.english: When we were at Saratoga I didn't notice any Yankee girls taking naps.
sentences.chinese: 在薩拉託加的時候，我沒見過一個北方女孩睡午覺的。

sentences.english: She wants to retire so she can take a nap.
sentences.chinese: 她希望退休，這樣就可以睡午覺了。

sentences.english: A morning to just get up, has a nap impulse.
sentences.chinese: 早上剛一起牀，就有一股睡午覺的衝動。
研究顯示，經常睡午覺會增加罹患二型糖尿病的危險。

sentences.english: Taking regular lunchtime siestas could increase the risk of developing Type 2 diabetes, according to research.
sentences.chinese: 研究顯示，經常睡午覺會增加罹患二型糖尿病的危險。

sentences.english: Mother put her daughter down for her nap.
sentences.chinese: 母親哄女兒上牀睡午覺。

sentences.english: Grandpa is really eww if he doesn't have his afternoon nap.
sentences.chinese: 祖父如果不睡午覺就會很暴躁。

sentences.english: Before going to bed at noon, read some English newspapers, or my exam will be failed again!
sentences.chinese: 臨睡午覺了，看看英文報紙，要不考試又要砸了。

sentences.english: It's time to take a nap.

definition: see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
matins/morning service (in the Catholic Church)/morning chorus (of birds)
to have a lie-in/to dawdle in bed
to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
talking in one's sleep/words spoken during sleep/fig. speech bearing no relation to reality/delusions
